exp1.title:
Web Developer 
The Center for Academic Services
exp1.description:
Worked as a Fullstack Web Developer at the Center for Academic Services, Mae Fah Luang University. Designed and developed a comprehensive web application from scratch, implementing: 

• Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for four main roles: Project Head, Dean, Admin, and Board, with page-level and approval permissions. 
• Google OAuth login with session management, email verification, and role-based access control. 
• Multi-page project proposal forms with AutoSave and file attachment support (PDF, Word, etc.) stored on the server. 
• Cost-benefit analysis forms calculating total cost, profit, per capita, and efficiency percentages automatically.  
• Multi-step workflow approval system reflecting current status and rejection reasons for each role. 
• Timeline tracking showing approval history with approver names, dates, and status, visible according to user roles. 
• Export functionality for PDF and Excel reports for committee submission and record-keeping. 
• User management with bulk import from Excel, including add, edit, delete, and permission assignment. 
• Dashboard displaying project statuses, filters by name/status/department, and overall revenue and expenses. 
• Automated proposal submission opening/closing based on schedule (node-cron). 
• Deployment using Docker, Docker Compose, Nginx, Linux, with reverse proxy configuration. 
• Real-time user control and permission guarding, including page/feature access, URL protection, and role-based menu visibility (middlewares). 
• Automated email notifications using Nodemailer. 

Implemented responsive UI/UX using Vue.js, HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap, and integrated backend functionalities with Node.js, Express, OAuth2, and MySQL.
